text_en: The cain is an extension of your arm. The index finger has to point down on the cane and you will be aware of different surfaces and obstacles.

Let the angle of the cane be around 45 degrees toward the surface. The main techniques are constant contact and touch technique. When using constant contact the cane has contact with the surface all the time and swing from side to side. This technique allow you to be aware of obstacles in front of you before you reach them.
Use trail technique when you walk along a house. Let the cane follow the wall. Use the thumb to support the cane. Then you know when you reach the end of the house.
When going up or down stairs, handle the cane vertically. Have the cane in front of you and measure the height of th next step.
Hold the cane vertically on the door and move it horisontally. Then you will find the door handle easily.
